title.narrative: CHILD-SENSITIVE BUDGETING/RESOURCES MOBILIZATION

description.narrative: By 2019, national and local actors have the capacity to develop child-sensitive budgets and to mobilize resources for the social sectors., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Private Sector Engagement, Private Sector Engagement (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and vulnerable people have access to sustainable social protection programmes and are benefitting from increasedbudget allocations in the social sectors.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, national and local actors have the capacity to develop child-sensitive budgets and to mobilize resources for the socialsectors.

description.narrative: Les droits des enfants ont été intégrés dans la planification nationale (PNDES II) et locale (PDL/PAI). Les;; capacités des institutions et des autorités aux niveau national et local sur la mobilisation des ressources domestiques, la planification et la budgétisation sensible aux ODD et aux droits des enfants ont été renforcées en 2021. La génération des évidences et le renforcement des capacités ont soutenu le dialogue politique, l’élaboration des documents de planification nationale (PNDES II) et locale (PDL), et la mobilisation des ressources domestiques en faveur des enfants. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
